question: The rulers of Bahmani kingdom encouraged the development of art and architecture in the form of cities, buildings, mosques and fortresses. The incorrect statement in this context is:
option1: The city of Hyderabad was founded by Ibrahim Adil Shah of Bijapur.
option2: Gol Gumbaz of Bijapur, the mausoleum of Mohammad Adil Shah is the largest dome.
option3: The Char Minar of Hyderabad was built by Mohammad Quli Qutb Shah of Golkunda.
option4: Mahmud Gawan built a college at Bidar.
answer: The city of Hyderabad was founded by Ibrahim Adil Shah of Bijapur.
explanation: Hyderabad was established in 1591 AD on the banks of the Musi River on the northern tip of the Deccan Plateau by Sultan Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah.
